title: Analysis of Instructional Design Failure Phenomena and Response Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic instructional design concepts and practical experience in mathematics education
context.additional_context: Practice-centered education using smartphone-based VR simulations, providing immediate feedback through formative assessment

learning_goals: Learners can classify instructional design failure cases into three types: process failure, outcome failure, and reflective opportunity.
Learners can analyze instructional design failure scenarios in VR simulation environments and propose response strategies.
Learners can derive at least two effective instructional design improvement plans in constrained technological environments (e.g., smartphones).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
